intro: Bothriocline schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian daisy, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features showy yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk of tubular florets, giving it a daisy-like appearance. It typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable species for ecological studies and potential horticultural use.
